body: Pallid waste where no radiant fathomers,The pain of being born into matter.Event, the end of the painted road ends upLike some poor wounded wretch—long left for deadXIII. The Route to the NorthAt the end of the road. Even if they are staringXIV. Franz Josef Land: The Amazing Drift of the TegetthoffHow bittersweet it is, on winter's night,To pick up even the quickening of windSculpting each tree to fit your ghostly form.Blurring the terrain,As if your absence now concluded long ago.It is as though I were at a second threshold.To pick up even the quickening of windAnd he is swathed in ever-petrified dread;But snow has gathered there, has piled up,V. The Dutch in the ArcticXIX. Jones Sound and Beaufort SeaThat rings, with faithful tongue, its pious note
